    level="1"
    right="Item 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Rune of Sin](/Equipment.aspx?ID=999)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Arcane" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=11" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Tattoo" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=262" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 165 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 1,700 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** tattooed on the body

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This jagged glyph, one of the [Thassilonian runes of sin](/Rules.aspx?ID=1567), reacts to magic of a particular school (there's no rune for [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), as it was considered lesser within sin magic). When you Cast a Spell of the school matching the sin, you gain resistance 5 to damage from spells until the start of your next turn. This resistance is increased to 7 against spells of the matching school. This tattoo has the school trait matching the rune: [abjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=2) for envy, [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117) for gluttony, [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157) for greed, [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61) for lust, [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) for pride, [conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33) for sloth, and [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65) for wrath.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
